pros: The environment was very welcoming.

job_title: Assistant Professor of Social Work in Charlotte, NC
pros: Location, Culture, Students, Experience, Easy road to tenure
cons: Non supportive, Culture, Easy road to tenure, not research driven, pay

pros: The rich history of JCSU is the biggest pro of working here. Knowing that you are adding to a tradition of Black excellence makes every day worth showing up. Also, most students are phenomenal and hungry for more knowledge.
cons: Lack of organization, the expectation of being overly flexible, things change immediately, and many members of senior administration are not very friendly, they aren't flexible, or student/staff centric.

pros: Dedicated staff and faculty who care about educating African American and other minority students. Students have high potential and need support and resources to reach those heights. JCSU has the ability to meet their academic needs.
cons: HBCUs have been chronically underfunded since their inception. The lack of financial resources makes it difficult to retain students and faculty/staff as well as build up-to-date facilities. Advocacy and fiscal policy changes for educational equality are necessary to make HBCUs - and JCSU in particular - on par with other less diverse institutions.

pros: The students are the best part
cons: The University could thrive, but there are people that have been in positions too long and aren't with the times

review_title: It's a great place to start working, get experience, then move on.
pros: The staff are very nice people.
cons: There is a lot of "big me, little you" that happens, even though staff are excellent at their positions and responsibilities throughout the institution.

pros: They are a growing institution.
cons: They need to improve their systems.

pros: educating youth, time off at Christmas (or summers in some roles)
cons: not much opportunity for growth or professional development

pros: Summers off. You can create your teaching schedule. Low stress environment. Support for research & travel.
cons: Low pay despite experience. You will teach a 4/4 load.

pros:
The institution exists for the overall good of higher education to diverse students.
There are some talented and caring faculty and staff who show up to do their job on a daily basis.
The campus is beautiful right outside of uptown Charlotte
cons: Leadership has created a toxic environment that surpasses "office politics".  The Administration lacks in experience to be fiscally responsible.  Jealousy, Fear, and Petty conflicts distract from providing quality education and services to students; who are paying private school tuition.

pros:
Flexible Schedule
Family atmosphere (at times)
Great office culture within your dept.
cons:
Although having a family atmospheres is great at times,  most of the time it's an impediment in getting your job done

Poor follow-up from JCSU community

Continuous Furlough

No incentives for being the "Trench Worker" or doing your job on top of everyone else's; unfortunately this seems to be the culture at this institution.

Every man or woman for themselves in dealing with upper management

Poor customer service skills internally

pros: It's nice certain department got great managers, but others are not playing fear to employees.
cons: Managers need training, very poor leadership not all but most. The HR department needs a new leader.

pros: Holiday pay. The University is shut down for two weeks for Christmas to New Years and you only have to use four vacation days.
cons: Pay is low and raises are infrequent.

pros: The students were great to work with; Convenient to downtown; Always available parking
cons: No support of department chairs and deans; Non-competitive compensation; Lack of educational structure and accountability

pros: University is headed in the right direction with great leadership.  Forward thinking vision.
cons: Delegated leaders need to lead.

pros: The people I work with I love them
cons: none it was all love every day

pros: Great place to work with good benefits.
